chapter.title: Converting Volumes
chapter.para: This chapter discusses converting compatibility volumes to EVMS volumes and converting EVMS volumes to compatibility volumes. For a discussion of the difference between compatibility and EVMS volumes see .

sect1.title: When to Convert Volumes
sect1.para: There are a several different scenarios that might help you determine what type of volumes you need. For example, if you wanted persistent names or to make full use of EVMS features, such as BBR, Drive Linking, or Snapshotting, you would convert your compatibility volumes to EVMS volumes. In another situation, you might decide that a volume needs to be read by a system that understands the underlying volume management scheme. In this case you would convert your EVMS volume to a compatibility volume.

sect1.title: Working through an Example of Converting Compatibility Volumes to EVMS Volumes
sect1.para:
A compatibility volume can be converted to an EVMS volume in the following situations:
The compatibility volume has no filesystem (FSIM) on it.
The compatibility volume has a filesystem, but the filesystem has been shrunk (if necessary) to make room for the EMVS metadata.
This section provides a detailed explanation of how to convert compatibility volumes to EVMS volumes by providing instructions to help you complete the following task.

example.title: Convert a compatibility volume
example.para: You have a compatability volume /dev/evms/hda3 that you want to make an EVMS volume named my_vol.

listitem.para: Choose Action Convert Compatibility Volume to EVMS .
Select /dev/evms/hda3 from the list of available volumes.
Type my_vol in the name field.
Click the Convert button to convert the volume.
Press the 2 key to see the volume view.
Highlight /dev/evms/hda3 by using the up and down arrow keys to scroll through the volumes.Press the Enter key.
Highlight Convert to EVMS Volume. Press the Enter key.
Type my_vol at the "::" prompt. Press the Enter key.

sect2.para: To convert a volume use the Convert command. sect1.title: Working through an Example of Converting EVMS Volumes to Compatibility Volumes
sect1.para: An EVMS volume can be converted to a compatibility volume only if the volume does not have EVMS features on it. This section provides a detailed explanation of how to convert EVMS volumes to compatibility volumes by providing instructions to help you complete the following task.

example.title: Convert an EVMS Volume
example.para: You have an EVMS volume, /dev/evms/my_vol that you want to make a compatibility volume.

listitem.para: Choose Action Convert EVMS Volume to Compatibility Volume .
Select /dev/evms/my_vol from the list of available volumes.
Click the Convert button to convert the volume.
Press the 2 key to see the volume view.
Highlight Convert to Compatibility Volume . Press the Enter key.
Highlight Convert to confirm. Press the Enter key.
